p: where β, δ, and γ denote the transmission rate, the infection (onset) rate, and the recovery rate, respectively. β(= R 0γ) is obtained by R 0, the initial infection-reproduction number. δ(= 1/ c) and γ(= 1/ h) are calculated by c, the incubation (latent) period, and h, the hospitalization (infectious) period, respectively. ρ(= 1/ d) is the rate at which people die and d is the infection-death period (i.e. days from infection to death). α is the death fatality rate.
